heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 28 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (187°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.6°C) and feels like temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 291 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 198 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 291.0m lower than yesterday, 72.7m lower than the past week, 198.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 845m and a high of 2560m, averaging 1113.4m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky may alternate between sunny and overcast.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and little or no wind. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (1.9°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
